title: Keystone Cardano Community Hub: Educating Next Generation
summary: Across India, students and developers lack structured Cardano education, mentorship, and community hubs, resulting in low awareness, limited skills, and slower on-chain adoption and ecosystem growth.
solution: We will build the Keystone Cardano Community Hub to run courses, events, and mentorship across India, guiding newcomers from awareness to wallets, staking, NFTs, and on-chain use, boosting adoption.
proposer_relevant_experience:
- Project Director – Prof. Sagar Rajebhosale

							Role:

    1. Overall project management and accountability
    2. Academic alignment with Keystone School of Engineering
    3. Scheduling, coordination with institute administration, and venue/lab readiness
    4. Co-delivery of sessions and quality control of educational activities
    5. Oversight of budget, reporting, and milestone delivery

LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/sagar\-rajebhosale\-2784b3298/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sagar-rajebhosale-2784b3298/)



- Lead Proposer, Head of Programme & Curriculum Lead – Mr. Vinit Inamke

       Role:

    1. Designs the full learning pathway for the Hub
    2. Creates curricula for workshops, bootcamps, clinics, and Cardano 101 sessions
    3. Leads technical teaching, practical labs, and on-chain activities
    4. Ensures content accuracy and alignment with the Cardano ecosystem
    5. Provides mentorship and technical guidance to students

LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/vinit\-inamke/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/vinit-inamke/)



- Community & Events Coordinator (Senior Student – To Be Appointed)

       Role:

    1. Handles event logistics (registrations, equipment, venue setup)
    2. Manages attendance logs, sign-in sheets, and participant tracking
    3. Moderates communication channels (Telegram/Discord/mailing list)
    4. Collects feedback and ensures continuous improvement of sessions
    5. Supports coordination during workshops, clinics, and meetups

Skill Gap Being Filled: Strong student organizer who can manage operations and maintain consistent communication.



- Industry Experts & Guest Instructors (Blockchain/Cardano Professionals)

       Role:

    1. Join selected workshops, bootcamps, and the mini-hackathon
    2. Provide real-world examples, review practical exercises, and mentor teams
    3. Help students understand real industry use-cases and ecosystem expectations

Commitment: Engagements already discussed with Cardano-aligned professionals in the network.



- Keystone Alumni (Web3/Cardano Practitioners)

       Role:

    1. Serve as co-mentors in technical sessions
    2. Share career journeys and practical insights
    3. Connect students to broader Cardano community opportunities

LinkedIn (Institute):

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/school/shalaka\-foundations\-keystone\-school\-of\-engineering\-pune/](https://www.linkedin.com/school/shalaka-foundations-keystone-school-of-engineering-pune/)



Future Team Additions (If Needed)

1. To ensure scalability, additional support may be recruited for:
2. Parallel workshop facilitation
3. Community management (Telegram/Discord moderation)
4. Technical assistance during live labs
5. Any new member will be publicly added with a clear role definition, ensuring transparency and full compliance with Catalyst guidelines.



Why This Team Can Deliver

- Strong academic leadership with proven experience running technical programmes
- Curriculum expertise from an alumnus already active in the Cardano/Web3 space
- Student-powered operational support for logistics and community building
- Access to industry mentors who strengthen quality and credibility
- Clear structure, defined responsibilities, and transparent collaboration
- This balanced team ensures the Hub is practical, scalable, and grounded in real Cardano usage — not theory.

sub_fields.answer: The core educational resources (detailed curricula, full lecture notes, lab materials and assessments) will remain proprietary to the Keystone Cardano Community Hub and will only be accessible to registered citizens of the Center of Excellence. These materials will not be released as open source and will be used exclusively within the Hub’s programmes. However, we will publish high-level public outputs such as event summaries, impact reports and selected introductory slides to document outcomes.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Who We’re Targeting

1. Students Across India (Primary Audience)
    1. Undergraduate & postgraduate engineering and CS students.
    2. Starting with Keystone School of Engineering and expanding to partner colleges.
    3. Ideal for:
        1. 1st–3rd year students exploring specializations.
        2. Final-year students seeking projects, internships, or startup ideas.
2. Early Developers & Tech Professionals (Secondary Audience)
    1. Young developers, alumni, and tech workers from Pune and nearby cities.
    2. Curious about Web3 but lacking structured Cardano onboarding.
3. Educators & Student Clubs (Tertiary Audience)
    1. Faculty members, technical clubs, student leaders.
    2. Act as multipliers integrating Cardano into courses, activities, and events.

How We’ll Reach Them

1. On-Campus Engagement
    1. Announcements via institute notices, faculty channels, classroom visits, seminars.
    2. Cardano 101 sessions each semester to onboard large batches quickly.
    3. Co-hosted meetups with coding, AI, blockchain, and entrepreneurship clubs.
2. Student Ambassadors & Peer Networks
    1. Trained Cardano Student Ambassadors promote sessions on campus and social media.
    2. Peer-study circles prepare students for workshops and on-chain activities.
3. Online Presence & Open Calls
    1. Telegram/Discord groups + simple info/registration page.
    2. Social media + WhatsApp + mailing lists used to push clear calls to action like “Create your first Cardano wallet this weekend!”
4. Flagship Bootcamps & Collaborations
    1. Hands-on bootcamps and mini-hackathons covering wallets, transactions, staking, NFTs.
    2. Invite nearby colleges and local developer communities to build a regional hub.
    3. Partnerships with incubation centers to position Cardano as an innovation tool.

Guided Pathway to On-Chain Adoption

We follow a structured funnel that converts interest → real on-chain participation:

1. Awareness Sessions → Wallet Creation
2. Fundamentals Workshops → First ADA Transactions
3. Advanced Sessions → Staking / NFT Minting / dApp Exploration

Why This Matters for Cardano

India hosts one of the world’s largest pools of students and developers — yet most campuses lack practical, Cardano-specific pathways.

The Keystone Cardano Community Hub provides a university-anchored, recurring onboarding engine that:

1. Converts Web3 curiosity into measurable Cardano adoption (wallets, transactions, staking).
2. Introduces new cohorts every semester, building a sustainable pipeline of contributors.
3. Creates a regional nucleus where Cardano projects, educators, and developers collaborate.
4. Shifts growth from one-off events to structured, long-term engagement.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Key Activities of the Project

- Cardano 101 Intro Sessions
    - Short on-campus talks + online webinars introducing Cardano basics and the Community Hub.
    - Goal: Give large groups their first structured touchpoint with Cardano.
- Hands-On Training Workshops (8–10 sessions)
    - Step-by-step practical sessions covering wallet setup, transactions, fees, staking, and simple dApps/NFT use.
    - Outcome: Immediate, guided on-chain usage through supervised labs.
- Wallet & Onboarding Clinics
    - Small, focused sessions where participants install wallets, secure seed phrases, and execute their first ADA transactions.
    - Outcome: Convert curiosity → measurable on-chain actions.
- Bootcamps & Mini-Courses
    - Weekend or one-week intensives that build independent Cardano skills.
    - Outcome: Participants learn to responsibly manage wallets, stake ADA, and try at least one dApp/NFT use case.
- Community Events & Hackathon
    - Recurring meetups, themed discussions, and one mini-hackathon/project showcase.
    - Outcome: Build an active community, highlight student projects, and create peer-to-peer learning.
- Student Ambassador & Study-Circle Program
    - A small team of trained ambassadors promoting events, supporting workshops, and running peer-learning circles.
    - Outcome: Stronger word-of-mouth reach and better retention.
- Measurement & Feedback Framework
    - Pre/post surveys, quizzes, attendance logs, retention tracking.
    - Outcome: Consistent data on knowledge growth, repeat participation, and impact.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Success Metrics

1. Community Engagement
    1. Minimum 12–15 events (Cardano 101, workshops, clinics, meetups, mini-hackathon).
    2. 300+ unique participants reached.
    3. 30–40% returning for multiple sessions.
    4. Formation of one active Cardano community group with regular communication.
2. Learning Impact & Retention
    1. Feedback score ≥ 4/5 across major events.
    2. Pre/post surveys to measure growth in Cardano knowledge & confidence.
    3. At least 100 participants progressing from intro sessions → workshops → clinics → bootcamps.
3. Digital Community Growth
    1. 200+ sign-ups across Telegram/Discord/mailing list.
    2. Month-on-month growth of active members.
    3. Track meaningful social engagement (comments, shares, sign-ups) rather than vanity metrics.
4. On-Chain Adoption
    1. Number of new Cardano wallets created during workshops/clinics.
    2. Number of transactions completed in guided labs.
    3. Participants who stake ADA or try a beginner-friendly dApp/NFT action.

These metrics collectively show whether the hub is creating real, sustained Cardano adoption rather than one-time exposure.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The Problem We Are Solving

There is interest in blockchain across India, but almost no structured way for students or developers to learn Cardano specifically.

Most campuses lack:

1. Regular Cardano presence
2. Mentors
3. Practical guidance for wallets, transactions, staking, or dApps

This means thousands of potential contributors never reach actual on-chain usage.



Our Solution: The Keystone Cardano Community Hub

A university-anchored, India-facing hub that provides a clear, repeatable pathway from curiosity → confident Cardano user.

We deliver this through a recurring cycle of:

1. Cardano 101 sessions
2. Hands-on workshops
3. Wallet onboarding clinics
4. Short bootcamps
5. Community meetups & a mini-hackathon

Instead of one-off events, the hub runs every semester, onboarding new cohorts and deepening engagement with existing ones.



Why a University Hub? (Our Approach)

We anchor the project within Keystone because:

1. Built-in audience: Thousands of motivated engineering & CS students in one place.
2. Multipliers: Faculty & student clubs can integrate Cardano into courses and events.
3. Trust & visibility: A campus setting lowers the barrier for newcomers cautious about crypto.

This base allows us to expand to partner institutions across India.



Who the Project Engages

1. Students from engineering, CS, and related fields
2. Local developers, alumni, and early-career professionals
3. Educators, technical clubs, and student leaders

Over time, this forms student project teams, developer groups, and micro-communities around Cardano.



How the Solution Works (Our Adoption Pathway)

We take participants through a simple, structured progression:

1. Awareness: Introductory sessions explaining Cardano’s purpose & strengths.
2. Hands-On Skills: Workshops covering wallet setup, security, transactions, fees, staking basics.
3. Confident Usage: Clinics and bootcamps where they stake ADA or try beginner-friendly dApps/NFTs.

At each stage, learning is practical and supervised, not just theoretical.



How We Will Demonstrate Impact

We measure the effectiveness of the Hub using:

1. Number of sessions held
2. Unique participants reached
3. Return/retention rates across events
4. Knowledge improvement (pre/post surveys)
5. Growth of online community channels
6. On-chain actions: wallets created, transactions initiated, ADA staked, dApps explored

These indicators show whether interest is being converted into actual Cardano participation.



What Makes This Solution Unique

1. Long-term presence, not one-off workshops
2. Campus-based trust, making adoption easier for newcomers
3. Hands-on, guided onboarding (wallets, transactions, staking)
4. Peer and mentor networks, not incentives or giveaways
5. A repeatable model that can be replicated at other universities across India



Who Benefits

1. Students & developers: Gain practical skills and confidence with on-chain actions
2. Educators & institutions: Receive ready-made Cardano content and support
3. Cardano ecosystem: Gains a steady, measurable pipeline of new users, builders & contributors from a huge education market

The hub becomes a scalable gateway for Cardano adoption across India.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
1. How our project brings value to the Cardano community

The Keystone Cardano Community Hub becomes a reliable, repeatable onboarding engine in one of the world’s largest education markets.

It delivers value by:

1. Providing a stable university-based entry point for new users.
2. Turning each semester into a new cohort of Cardano users, stakers, and future builders.
3. Creating a steady stream of:
    1. New wallets
    2. Transactions
    3. Staking activity
    4. Informed community members
4. Establishing a model that can be replicated across other campuses in India.

This is long-term ecosystem growth, not one-off marketing.

2. How we will measure this impact

We use three measurement layers:

1. Education & Community Metrics
    1. Number of events held
    2. Total participants reached
    3. Repeat attendance & retention rates
    4. Knowledge gains measured through pre/post surveys
2. Digital Community Growth
    1. Telegram/Discord/mailing list sign-ups
    2. Month-to-month active membership
    3. Engagement on event announcements & recaps
3. On-Chain Adoption (Core Catalyst KPI)
    1. Wallets created during clinics
    2. First transactions completed
    3. ADA staking
    4. Activity on beginner-friendly dApps/NFT platforms

These metrics clearly show whether people are moving from awareness → real on-chain participation.

3. How we will share outputs with the Cardano community

We will share high-level learnings and public-facing outputs through:

1. Event summaries & bootcamp recap posts
2. Anonymized impact metrics
3. Selected introductory slide decks
4. A short playbook covering our approach, outreach tactics, and lessons learned
5. Public project reports on accessible web pages and social media

These resources help other educators, projects, and hubs replicate or adapt the model.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Experience & Capability

Prof. Sagar Rajebhosale serve as the Head of the Computer Engineering Department at Keystone School of Engineering.

His role involves:

1. Planning and delivering academic programmes
2. Coordinating faculty, labs, and events
3. Designing curricula and workshops
4. Managing logistics for guest lectures, training programmes, and student activities

These responsibilities directly mirror what is needed to run a structured, semester-based Cardano education hub.

Proven Ability to Execute

Over several years, I have successfully coordinated technical events that require:

1. Venue and equipment management
2. Communication with students, faculty, and external speakers
3. Gathering feedback and improving delivery
4. Handling multiple stakeholders efficiently

The Cardano Hub builds on the same strengths:

organized sessions, student mobilisation, and smooth execution.

Financial Responsibility & Transparency

As HOD, he routinely manage department-level budgets, including:

- Preparing estimates
- Selecting vendors within institutional policies
- Keeping auditable records of expenses

For this project, we will apply strict, transparent processes:

- Clear Work Plan & Budgeting
    - Each activity (sessions, workshops, bootcamps, materials) mapped to a defined cost.
- Dedicated Catalyst Wallet
    - All project funds handled separately with a detailed transaction log (date, amount, purpose, receipt).
- Use of Institutional Procedures
    - Where possible, payments will go through Keystone’s standard procurement rules for added oversight.
- Full Documentation
    - Invoices, receipts, and consolidated records linked to the budget tracker.
- Milestone-Based Internal Reviews
    - Regular checks on planned vs. actual spending to ensure alignment with the Catalyst proposal.
- Spending Tied to Outputs
    - Every expense must correspond to an activity that benefits the Cardano community.

These steps demonstrate a high-trust, auditable financial process.

Why This Approach Is Feasible

My daily work already requires:

- Accountability to faculty and administration
- Transparent reporting
- Deadline-oriented planning
- Efficient resource management

Applying these same systems to the Cardano Hub ensures reliable delivery, responsible fund management, and proven feasibility.

sub_fields.answer: Hub setup, infrastructure & pilot sessions

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. Core Keystone Cardano Community Hub team formed with roles clearly defined.
2. Initial infrastructure prepared: room setup, essential equipment, printed materials, and outreach assets.
3. Full 12-month activity calendar created with survey templates and attendance tracking tools.
4. Cardano 101 introductory content + basic workshop curriculum developed.
5. 2 Cardano 101 sessions and 1 pilot hands-on workshop delivered to validate the setup.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. At least 100 unique participants attend the intro + pilot sessions.
2. 70%+ of feedback responses confirm improved understanding of Cardano.
3. Calendar, curricula, infrastructure summary, and measurement framework fully documented and ready for scale.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. PDF/docs: team list, hub structure, calendar, curriculum drafts, infrastructure summary.
2. Photos of physical setup and screenshots/links to Telegram, Discord, and mailing list.
3. Attendance sheets + anonymized survey results from initial sessions.
4. Brief milestone report summarizing activities, early learnings, and use of funds.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Budget Summary (60,000 ADA • 12 Months)

Keystone provides classrooms, labs, internet, electricity, and base AV in-kind, so Catalyst funds cover only programme delivery, community engagement, and documentation.

No funds go to software development, hardware purchases, or token/ADA incentives.

Stage 1 — Hub Setup & Programme Design (Months 1–6)

Total: 30,000 ADA

1. Programme & Curriculum Design – 18,000 ADA
    1. Led by Head of Programme, designing the full learning pathway.
    2. Includes Cardano 101 content, workshop curricula, bootcamp structure, and onboarding clinic materials.
2. Project Management & Coordination – 5,000 ADA
    1. Lead Proposer’s time to coordinate with Keystone administration, schedule activities, secure labs, manage reporting, and set up measurement tools.
3. Hub Setup, Outreach & Materials – 5,000 ADA
    1. Posters, printed handouts, event branding, registration forms, and content for a simple landing/info page.
    2. Minor AV enhancements if needed.
4. Tools & Contingency – 2,000 ADA
    1. Webinar upgrades, cloud storage/hosting, and a small buffer for setup essentials.

Stage 2 — Core Education & Onboarding (Months 7-10)

Total: 20,000 ADA

1. Workshops & Clinics Delivery – 10,000 ADA
    1. Trainer time for 6 structured workshops + 2 wallet/onboarding clinics.
    2. Includes preparation, facilitation, and content refinement based on feedback.
2. Community & Events Coordination – 3,000 ADA
    1. Stipend for a senior student coordinator.
    2. Covers registrations, equipment setup, attendance logs, Telegram/Discord management, and follow-up communication.
3. Events Logistics & Participant Support – 4,000 ADA
    1. Refreshments for longer sessions, printing additional handouts, stationery, and minor venue/AV needs.
4. Guest Trainers & Industry Mentors – 3,000 ADA
    1. Honoraria and local travel for Cardano/Web3 professionals supporting workshops and meetups.

Stage 3 — Bootcamps, Showcase & Reporting (Months 11–12)

Total: 10,000 ADA

1. Bootcamps & Mini-Hackathon/Showcase – 4,000 ADA
    1. Trainer/mentor time and logistics for 1–2 bootcamps & one final showcase or mini-hackathon.
2. Final Event Logistics & Documentation – 4,000 ADA
    1. Venue support, materials, photography, and creation of consolidated impact summaries (metrics, visuals).
3. Close-Out Report & Video – 2,000 ADA
    1. Editing, design, and technical support for the final Catalyst-required report and video.

Third-Party Services & Shortfall Coverage

- Limited to: guest mentors, modest design work, video editing, and minor AV upgrades.
- No legal, accounting, software dev, hardware, or incentive costs.
- If expenses slightly exceed 60,000 ADA, Keystone covers the shortfall through in-kind support (extra rooms, AV, staff time) or small local sponsorships.
- No additional funding will be requested from Catalyst.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
Value for Money: Why This Budget Is Strong for the Cardano Ecosystem

1. Direct Spending on Adoption, Not Infrastructure
    1. Keystone provides classrooms, labs, electricity, internet, and base AV at zero cost, so Catalyst funds are not spent on facilities.
    2. Nearly the entire 60,000 ADA budget goes toward curriculum design, trainer time, workshops, clinics, bootcamps, community events, and reporting.
    3. Every ADA contributes directly to creating new wallets, transactions, staking actions, and long-term Cardano users.
2. Highly Cost-Effective in the Indian Context
    1. Professional training programs in India typically cost several thousand rupees per participant for only a few days.
    2. In contrast, this project will engage 300+ unique learners over a full year, with many participating in multiple sessions.
    3. The cost per learner and cost per onboarded wallet is far below local market rates, especially considering the depth of hands-on guidance and involvement of experienced Cardano mentors.
3. Reusable Assets That Outlive the Grant
    1. The largest budget portion is invested in designing high-quality educational materials: Cardano 101 slides, workshop curricula, bootcamp structure, onboarding flows.
    2. These assets become permanent resources for Keystone and can be reused for future cohorts for years without additional Catalyst funding.
    3. This makes the project sustainable, repeatable, and scalable beyond the initial grant.
4. Transparent, Milestone-Linked Spending
    1. Each spending category maps directly to measurable outputs: events delivered, participants trained, wallets created, and on-chain actions completed.
    2. There are no hidden costs, no spending on software development, hardware, incentives, airdrops, or speculative activities.
    3. Third-party expenses are extremely limited (guest mentors, minor AV upgrades, design/video work).
    4. All costs are tracked transparently with invoices, logs, and milestone reporting.
5. Long-Term Ecosystem Impact Per ADA
    1. Instead of a one-time campaign, this investment builds a permanent Cardano presence on a university campus.
    2. It creates a steady pipeline of new users, developers, and future contributors from one of the world’s largest education markets.
    3. The impact continues long after funding ends, making this high-ROI, low-waste spending for the ecosystem.
